Class Filter

  • java.lang.Object
    • Filter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Filter1GapFinder, Filter2ReverseComplementor, Filter3FrameBuilder, Filter4Translator, Filter5ORFFinder

    public class Filter
extends java.lang.Object
    Parent Class of all other filters. It's primary function is to hold the stopping values as well as handle putting and getting inputs from the buffer.
    Author:
    Kyle Dorcey

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Buffer inputBufferLocation
      Object reference to the buffer from which input is received from
      private java.lang.String noFirstandSecondPrefix
      Arbitrary String which is used to tell other filters when it is reading a DNA sequence with its first two base pairs removed
      private java.lang.String noFirstInputPrefix
      Arbitrary String which is used to tell other filters when it is reading a DNA sequence with its first base pairs removed
      private Buffer outputBufferLocation
      Object refrerence to the buffer from which the filter outputs (puts) information in
      private java.lang.String partialStop
      Arbitrary String that is placed at either an edited or unedited DNA sequence to denote when it ends and another begins
      private java.lang.String stopValue
      Arbitrary String which represents when the different filters should stop trying to receive new input from the buffer
      private java.lang.String unchangedInputPrefix
      Arbitrary String which is used to show when the unchanged DNA sequences begin

      • Filter

        public Filter(Buffer inputBufferLocation,
              Buffer outputBufferLocation)
        Class constructor for Filter. Called by all other filters via the "super()" syntax.
        Parameters:
        inputBufferLocation - Object reference to the buffer from which input is received from
        outputBufferLocation - Object reference to the buffer that has items placed into it.

        public void putInBuffer(java.lang.String stringToInsert)

        Parameters:

        public java.lang.String getFromBuffer()
